fields_of_interest: Humanitarian aid and civil protection, International co-operation and development, Education and training, Energy, Environment, Youth, Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, External Relations
eu_initiatives: Granted legal personality as an international civil association under Belgian law and first registered on EU Transparency Register on 21 March 2013, Eri-Platform AISBL advocates the supremacy of the rule of law, adherence to democratic principles, respect for human rights, celebration of diversity and the pursuit of social justice as essential elements for a viable system of democratic governance.
subsection: Non-governmental organisations, platforms and networks and similar
membership:
Global Governance Institute 
Free University of Brussels (VUB) 
Vesalius College 
European Centre for Electoral Support 
Brand Ambassador - Wallon / Belgium
relevant_communication: Eri-Platform endeavours to actively engage in devising, applying and reinforcing a programme of broad and inclusive dialogue among political, civil, human rights and media groups in specific live forums and online via its website in alignment with the fundamental principles and essential elements of rule of law, democratic principles and human rights. It pleads for adherence to these principles via regular updates and  consultations with chairpersons and members of different committees in the European Parliament and with senior officials in the EUR COM and EEAS.
goals__remit: Eri-Platform AISBL is an international civil association that advocates inclusive dialogue, both live and online, mainly among Eritreans at home and in the Diaspora and friends of Eritrea, as well as in the Horn of Africa, to help resolve conflicts, bridge divisions, and pursue common goals among different or diverse political, civil, human rights and media groups. It works to promote multifaceted consultations to cultivate an understanding of and respect for the rule of law, democratic principles and human rights.
